title: 民主黨狙擊特朗普與AV女星醜聞 美政治顧問：徒勞無功

replies.msg:
美國總統特朗普被成人電影女星斯蒂芬尼指控，曾委託私人律師科恩給予掩口費。民主黨就此事窮追猛打，甚至希望彈劾特朗普，就如當年共和黨人借「萊溫斯基」事件，「追殺」前總統克林頓一樣。不過曾任克林頓政治顧問的莫里斯（Dick Morris）卻指，選民對斯蒂芬尼事件全無興趣，民主黨人此舉只是徒勞無功，甚至可能令共和黨在中期選舉大勝。

莫里斯日前在親共和黨報章《The Western Journal》撰文，及在共和黨新聞網站The Cats Roundtable的訪問中指出，特朗普雖然爆出連串「醜聞」，但人們更關心的是其施政成效，尤其是對就業、貿易、移民、反恐、北韓及伊朗等問題。

莫里斯列舉幾個新聞網站的數字，顯示爆出斯蒂芬尼掩口費事件之後，民眾對特朗普的整體支持率不跌反升，維持44.4%，較去年12月的37%及上月的41.5%還要高，當中在經濟、就業、稅收、移民及對付極端回教組織「伊斯蘭國」等議題的施政，支持率更超過50%

Fmr. Bill Clinton Adviser: Country Doesn't 'Give a Damn' About Stormy Daniels

A former adviser to President Bill Clinton, Dick Morris, predicted Republicans will overwhelmingly win during the midterms because Democrats are focused on issues that aren't a voting factor to most of the country.

During an interview on “The Cats Roundtable,” Morris explained that in the 1990s when he worked for Clinton, Republicans thought they had a “gold mine” when the Monica Lewinsky scandal came out.

While Republicans only talked about impeachment and the scandal, when election time came, Democrats gained seats, which is what he predicts will happen come midterms.

“The Democrats who are attacking [President Donald] Trump think that they have a panacea in the Stormy Daniels scandal and the possibility of impeachment, and that's all they're talking about,” he explained.

Morris narrowed in on the topics of Daniels, Trump attorney Michael Cohen, and Russia as Democratic talking points and contrasted it with the Republicans' focus.

“The Republicans and Trump are talking about jobs and terrorism and Korea and Iran,” he told radio host John Catsimatidis.

He pointed out that as a whole, Republicans have seen a steady rise in approval ratings while Democrats have been steadily dropping. Morris said Trump's approval rating since the scandal has gone from 40 percent to 45 percent.

“The same sort of fool's gold that deceived the Republicans in '98 is now luring the Democrats into making the same mistake this year,” the former Clinton adviser warned.

Morris cautioned the Democrats of putting everything into the scandal because “the country doesn't give a damn.”

He told Catsimatidis that unlike his alleged affair with Daniels, Americans care about Trump's success with North Korea and ISIS.

“There is no blue wave coming,” Morris concluded. “There's a red wave, and what makes it red is the blood of the Democratic Party.”
